verses.verse: (John 4:38; 20:21) As You sent Me into the world, I also have sent them into the world.
And (1 Cor. 1:2; 1 Thess. 4:7; (Heb. 10:10)) for their sakes I sanctify Myself, that they also may be sanctified by the truth.
Jesus Prays for All Believers “I do not pray for these alone, but also for those who will believe in Me through their word;

((John 10:16; Rom. 12:5; Gal. 3:28); Eph. 4:4, 6) that they all may be one, as (John 10:38; 17:11, 23) You, Father, are in Me, and I in You; that they also may be one in Us, that the world may believe that You sent Me.
And the (John 14:20; 1 John 1:3) glory which You gave Me I have given them, ((2 Cor. 3:18)) that they may be one just as We are one:
I in them, and You in Me; ((Col. 3:14)) that they may be made perfect in one, and that the world may know that You have sent Me, and have loved them as You have loved Me.

((John 12:26; 14:3; 1 Thess. 4:17)) “Father, I desire that they also whom You gave Me may be with Me where I am, that they may behold My glory which You have given Me; (Matt. 25:34; John 17:5) for You loved Me before the foundation of the world.
O righteous Father! (John 15:21) The world has not known You, but (John 7:29; 8:55; 10:15) I have known You; and (John 3:17; 17:3, 8, 18, 21, 23) these have known that You sent Me.
(Ex. 34:5-7; John 17:6) And I have declared to them Your name, and will declare it, that the love (John 15:9; (Eph. 3:17-19)) with which You loved Me may be in them, and I in them.”

Betrayal and Arrest in Gethsemane When Jesus had spoken these words, (Matt. 26:30, 36; Mark 14:26, 32; Luke 22:39) He went out with His disciples over (2 Sam. 15:23; 1 Kin. 2:37; 15:13; 2 Kin. 23:4, 6, 12; 2 Chr. 15:16; 29:16; 30:14; Jer. 31:40) the Brook Kidron, where there was a garden, which He and His disciples entered.
And Judas, who betrayed Him, also knew the place; (Luke 21:37; 22:39) for Jesus often met there with His disciples.

(Matt. 26:47-56; Mark 14:43-50; Luke 22:47-53; Acts 1:16) Then Judas, having received a detachment of troops, and officers from the chief priests and Pharisees, came there with lanterns, torches, and weapons.
Jesus therefore, (John 6:64; 13:1, 3; 19:28) knowing all things that would come upon Him, went forward and said to them, “Whom are you seeking?”

They answered Him, (Matt. 21:11; Mark 1:24; 14:67; 16:6; Luke 18:37; 24:19) “Jesus of Nazareth.” Jesus said to them, “I am He. ” And Judas, who (Ps. 41:9; Matt. 20:18; 26:21; John 13:21) betrayed Him, also stood with them.
Now when He said to them, “I am He, ” they drew back and fell to the ground.
Then He asked them again, “Whom are you seeking?” And they said, “Jesus of Nazareth.”
Jesus answered, “I have told you that I am He. Therefore, if you seek Me, let these go their way,”
that the saying might be fulfilled which He spoke, ((John 6:39; 17:12)) “Of those whom You gave Me I have lost none.”
(Matt. 26:51; Mark 14:47; Luke 22:49, 50) Then Simon Peter, having a sword, drew it and struck the high priest’s servant, and cut off his right ear. The servant’s name was Malchus.
So Jesus said to Peter, “Put your sword into the sheath. Shall I not drink (Matt. 20:22; 26:39; Mark 14:36; Luke 22:42) the cup which My Father has given Me?”
Before the High Priest Then the detachment of troops and the captain and the officers of the Jews arrested Jesus and bound Him.
And (Matt. 26:57) they led Him away to (Luke 3:2; John 18:24; Acts 4:6) Annas first, for he was the father-in-law of (Matt. 26:3; John 11:49, 51) Caiaphas who was high priest that year.
(John 11:50) Now it was Caiaphas who advised the Jews that it was expedient that one man should die for the people.

Peter Denies Jesus (Matt. 26:58; Mark 14:54; Luke 22:54) And Simon Peter followed Jesus, and so did (John 20:2-5) another disciple. Now that disciple was known to the high priest, and went with Jesus into the courtyard of the high priest.

(Matt. 26:69; Mark 14:66-68; Luke 22:55-57) But Peter stood at the door outside. Then the other disciple, who was known to the high priest, went out and spoke to her who kept the door, and brought Peter in.
Then the servant girl who kept the door said to Peter, “You are not also one of this Man’s disciples, are you?” He said, “I am (Matt. 26:34) not.”
Now the servants and officers who had made a fire of coals stood there, for it was cold, and they warmed themselves. And Peter stood with them and warmed himself.
Jesus Questioned by the High Priest The high priest then asked Jesus about His disciples and His doctrine.

Jesus answered him, (Matt. 26:55; Luke 4:15; John 8:26) “I spoke openly to the world. I always taught (John 6:59) in synagogues and (Mark 14:49; John 7:14, 28) in the temple, where the Jews always meet, and in secret I have said nothing.
Why do you ask Me? Ask (Mark 12:37) those who have heard Me what I said to them. Indeed they know what I said.”

And when He had said these things, one of the officers who stood by (Job 16:10; Is. 50:6; Jer. 20:2; Lam. 3:30; Acts 23:2) struck Jesus with the palm of his hand, saying, “Do You answer the high priest like that?”
Jesus answered him, “If I have spoken evil, bear witness of the evil; but if well, why do you strike Me?”
(Matt. 26:57; Luke 3:2; Acts 4:6) Then Annas sent Him bound to (John 11:49) Caiaphas the high priest.

Peter Denies Twice More Now Simon Peter stood and warmed himself. (Matt. 26:71-75; Mark 14:69-72; Luke 22:58-62) Therefore they said to him, “You are not also one of His disciples, are you?” He denied it and said, “I am not!”
One of the servants of the high priest, a relative of him whose ear Peter cut off, said, “Did I not see you in the garden with Him?”
Peter then denied again; and (Matt. 26:74; Mark 14:72; Luke 22:60; John 13:38) immediately a rooster crowed.

In Pilate’s Court (Matt. 27:2; Mark 15:1; Luke 23:1; Acts 3:13) Then they led Jesus from Caiaphas to the Praetorium, and it was early morning. (John 11:55; Acts 10:28; 11:3) But they themselves did not go into the Praetorium, lest they should be defiled, but that they might eat the Passover.
(Matt. 27:11-14; Mark 15:2-5; Luke 23:2, 3) Pilate then went out to them and said, “What accusation do you bring against this Man?”
They answered and said to him, “If He were not an evildoer, we would not have delivered Him up to you.”
Then Pilate said to them, “You take Him and judge Him according to your law.” Therefore the Jews said to him, “It is not lawful for us to put anyone to death,”
